qas.question: When did Ireland first open comprehensive schools?
Who was responsible for creating comprehensive schools in Ireland?
What was the only state-run educational system in Ireland prior to comprehensive schools?
What type of school has surpassed comprehensive schools in Ireland?
When did Ireland last open comprehensive schools?
When did Ireland first close comprehensive schools?
Who was unresponsible for creating comprehensive schools in Ireland?
What wasn't the only state-run educational system in Ireland prior to comprehensive schools?
What type of school has surpassed uncomprehensive schools in Ireland?

context: Comprehensive schools were introduced into Ireland in <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>1966<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> by an initiative by <a1_0><b6_0>Patrick Hillery<b6_0/><a1_0/>, Minister for Education, to give a broader range of education compared to that of the <a2_0><b7_0>vocational school system<b7_0/><a2_0/>, which was then the only system of schools completely controlled by the state. Until then, education in Ireland was largely dominated by religious persuasion, particularly the voluntary secondary school system was a particular realisation of this. The comprehensive school system is still relatively small and to an extent has been superseded by the <a3_0><b8_0>community school<b8_0/><a3_0/> concept. The Irish word for a comprehensive school is a 'scoil chuimsitheach.'
